intro: Euryops evansii, commonly known as the Evans' bushveld daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in shrubland and grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its bright yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green ray florets, creating a striking visual contrast. Euryops evansii is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
